attributes.action: No mandatory vaccinations for NHS, health & social care or any other workers.
attributes.additional_details: Health care staff has been fighting Covid with great dedication and often at great risk and personal cost to themselves and their loved ones. Being a health worker can not deprive us from exercising our basic human rights. Available jabs are still in clinical trials and do not have a full market authorisations by MHRA. There is no sufficient data on long term side effects. We demand for our choices on bodily integrity to be respected. No pressure or coercion to get vaccinated should be accepted.
attributes.background: We want Government to commit to not mandating C19 or any other vaccinations for the health & social care staff. Prevent employers and companies from discriminating or dismissing staffs who for whatever reason, be it personal choices, beliefs or concerns, do not wish to be vaccinated.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not require health and social care workers to take covid-19 vaccination: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577842

Prohibit employers from requiring employees to have a Covid-19 vaccine: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575607
